action.action-desc: Ms. DeLauro (for herself and Mr. Courtney) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: Expressing support for the designation of April 10, 2015, as Venture Smith’s Freedom Day.

whereas.text: Whereas 250 years ago, in the year 1765, Venture Smith, at the age of 36, purchased his freedom;
Whereas Venture Smith went on to free his family from the bondage of slavery;
Whereas Venture Smith went on to become a successful businessman in the State of Connecticut; and
Whereas, April 10, 2015, would be an appropriate date to designate as Venture Smith's Freedom Day: Now, therefore, be it

section.text: That the House of Representatives supports the designation of Venture Smith's Freedom Day, which would recognize the 250th anniversary of Venture Smith purchasing his freedom and going on to become a successful businessman in Connecticut.
